chapter.p: 1On that day, this song will be sung in the land of Judah:

ul.li1: “We have a strong city;Literally “a city of strength for us”
ul.li2: he sets up victory like walls and ramparts!Hebrew “rampart”

chapter.p: 2Open the gates so thatOr “and” the righteous nation who keeps faithfulness may enter!

ul.li1: 3You will protect a firm inclination in peace,
ul.li2: in peace because he trusts in you.
ul.li1: 4Trust in Yahweh forever,
ul.li2: for in Yah, Yahweh you have an everlasting rock.
ul.li1: 5For he has thrown down the inhabitants of the height,
ul.li2: he lays low the lofty city.
ul.li1: He lays it low to the ground;
ul.li2: he throws her to the dust.
ul.li1: 6The foot tramples it,
ul.li2: the feet of the poor, the steps of the needy.”

ul.li1: 7The way of the righteous is a straight path;
ul.li2: you clear the level path of the righteous.Literally “the level path of the righteous you make level”; the meaning of this phrase is uncertain
ul.li1: 8Surely we wait for you in the path of your judgments, Yahweh,
ul.li2: for your name and renown are the desire of the soul.
ul.li1: 9I desire you with all my soul in the night;
ul.li2: also I seek you with my spirit within me,
ul.li1: for when your judgments are uponLiterally “to” the earth,
ul.li2: the inhabitants of the world learn righteousness.

chapter.p: 10Though the wicked person is shown compassion, he does not learn righteousness;

ul.li1: he acts unjustly in the land of uprightness,
ul.li2: and he does not see the majesty of Yahweh.

chapter.p: 11Yahweh, though your hand reaches high, they do not see it.

ul.li1: Let them see, and let them be ashamed of the zeal of people.
ul.li2: Indeed, let the fire of your enemies consume them.
ul.li1: 12Yahweh, you will establish peace for us,
ul.li2: for you have done even all of our works for us.
ul.li1: 13Yahweh, our God, lords besides you ruled over us,
ul.li2: but we praise your name alone.Literally “alone in you we praise name you”
ul.li1: 14The dead do not live;
ul.li2: dead spirits do not rise
ul.li1: because you have punished and destroyed them,
ul.li2: and you have destroyed all memory of them.
ul.li1: 15You have added to the nation, Yahweh.
ul.li2: You have added to the nation; you are honored.
You have extended all the ends of the land.
ul.li1: 16Yahweh, in distress they have visited you;
ul.li2: they poured out an incantation;Literally “whispering”
your discipline was on them.
ul.li1: 17Like a pregnant woman on the point of giving birth, she writhes;
ul.li2: she cries in her labor pains.

chapter.p: So we were because of your presence, Yahweh.

ul.li1: 18We became pregnant, we writhed;
ul.li2: we gave birth to wind.
ul.li1: We cannot bring about deliverance on the earth,
ul.li2: and no inhabitants of the world are born.
ul.li1: 19Your dead shall live; their corpsesLiterally “my corpse;” some manuscripts propose an emendation to the suffix to change it to third person masculine plural (“their corpses”), which makes better sense shall rise.
ul.li2: Wake up and sing for joy, dwellers of the dust,
ul.li1: for your dew is celestial dew,Literally “dew of light”
ul.li2: and the earth will give birth to dead spirits.Or “you make the land of Rephaim fall”
ul.li1: 20Go, my people, enter into your chambers
ul.li2: and shut your doorsThe reading tradition (Qere) is singular behind you;
ul.li1: hide for a very littleLiterally “a little a little” while,
ul.li2: until the wrath has passed over.
ul.li1: 21For look! Yahweh is about to come out from his place
ul.li2: to punish the iniquity of the inhabitantsHebrew “inhabitant” of the earth against him,
ul.li1: and the earth will disclose her blood
ul.li2: and will no longer cover her slain.
